description: This course introduces first-year students to the dialogue between Biblical traditions and the cultures and communities related to them. Students study major Biblical texts and their interaction with, for example, theology, religious practice, ethics, and social values, while considering methods and fields in the study of religion in a liberal arts setting. Thematic emphases differ based on section and instructor.
name: Bible/Culture/Commun
notes: This course includes an academic civic engagement (ACE) component.
Section topic: Politics in the Bible and the Bible in Politics
This course includes an academic civic engagement (ACE) component.

title: Bible in Culture and Community
